intro: Axinanthera, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plants typically have slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Axinanthera species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. They are often found in meadows, roadsides, and other disturbed habitats.
